attributes.action: Require clear labelling on all products linked to deforestation.
attributes.background: Require by law that all products display an immediately visible symbol, showing any links to deforestation. This will allow the public to make fully informed buying choices to actively prevent the climate crisis worsening.
attributes.additional_details: If current trends continue, more than a quarter of the Amazon biome will be without trees by 2030 (WWF), further accelerating the climate crisis. The Environment Bill introduced on 10th November requires due diligence on sourcing standards, but does not inform UK citizens of the consequences of their choices at purchase points. Clear labelling on products will allow the public to quickly identify and avoid products and services linked to deforestation.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban the import of soy and beef products not certified as free from deforestation
attributes.background: I want the UK government to make it illegal for beef and soy imports to have deforestation in their supply chain.
attributes.additional_details: 73% of deforestation in the Amazon is driven by agricultural land expansion for soy and cattle ranching. We cannot reach our Paris Climate Agreements targets without ameliorating the emissions we are responsible for creating abroad. Deforestation is a huge contributor to climate change and must end if we are to tackle the global climate crisis. Currently only 27% of soy in the UK is certified as not being associated with deforestation and this is not good enough!

attributes.action: Ban UK imports of soy not certified as being grown sustainably
attributes.background: The growing of soy beans in environmentally sensitive regions (e.g. the Amazon Rainforest) is helping to fuel deforestation and climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
Much of these soy products are exported to the UK for animal feeds, and some for direct human consumption, where alternatives products are available
The UK government has a responsibility to reduce environmental impacts. This includes indirect impact via consumption.
 
Much soy in the UK is used for animal feed (~75% by weight), so its environmental damage is not seen by the consumer. The UK government needs to ban imports of soy where it cannot be certified that its production is not negatively impacting the environment, pushing our production markets to use more environmentally friendly sources of soy or alternatives products altogether.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on Brazil due to unabated destruction of the Amazon
attributes.background: The Government should impose economic sanctions on Brazil to pressure its government to take action to halt deforestation. The 'lungs of the world' are being destroyed at an alarming rate, and the Bolsonaro administration has failed to limit legal deforestation or tackle illegal deforestation.
attributes.additional_details: We believe Bolsonaro has repeatedly ignored the concerns of the international community and had little regard for the indigenous population or the unique and spectacular wildlife that exists in the Amazon. In the midst of a climate emergency, the UK cannot sit back and watch this continued destruction without taking action.

attributes.action: Reform food, energy, environmental and fishing policy to save the planet
attributes.background: Following the airing of David Attenborough’s programme “Life on our planet”, the Government should take action and implement new laws, restrictions and taxes to: reduce meat production and consumption, switch to 100% renewable energy, stop all deforestation and ban over-fishing.
attributes.additional_details: We are at a critical tipping point. If we do not make changes now, it will be too late. In a matter of less than 10 years, we could see irreversible change that will have devastating impacts for the planet, and our species. We need to start acting on what the experts & natural world is telling and showing us in order to save the planet. We are an influential nation - if we create lasting change, others will follow and we will make the difference desperately needed.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban import of products from Amazon rainforest if not Deforestation Free
attributes.background: The Amazon Rainforest, home to thousands of species of plants and animals, plays a vital role in balancing the world's climate. However this year once again has seen an increase in deforestation, 64% up. Last year UK imported 1billion pounds on beef linked to illegal destrction of the rainforest.
attributes.additional_details:
Furthermore ingredients in products such as Chocolate, Moisturiser, Shampoo, Nuts, Coffee, Soya, Chicken and Palm Oil are all imported to the UK from the Amazon Rainforest. With only 14% of imports from the Amazon deforestation free we are calling on the government to make all products not deforestation free illegal in the UK. How much more of the rainforest needs to be cut before we stop purchasing these illegal products? 

> https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-51300515  
> https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-49973997

attributes.action: Require products be labelled as "containing palm oil" or "palm oil free"
attributes.background: The Government should make it compulsory that on any product available to purchase in the UK, it clearly states on the packaging whether it contains ‘palm oil’ or is ‘palm oil free’, using a standardised logo.
attributes.additional_details: This should be compulsory to make it simple for customers to understand whether or not the products that they are purchasing are containing Pam oil or not. A simple logo on packaging that can be seen and recognised in a similar way as the nutritional bar that is on food products. Palm Oil is used in many products when it was not in the past, and its production is a huge contributor to deforestation. Please help save the planet.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Require large companies to only use responsibly sourced palm oil in products.
attributes.background: Enforce this with large UK based companies only to produce products containing responsibly sourced palm oil which is grown as a result of deforestation in rainforests and other vital habitats, endangering many animals around the world.
attributes.additional_details: My daughter (7 years old) came across a book in the local library about endangered Orangutans and the devastating affect/decline in numbers due to deforestation to make way for palm oil plantations. We were incredibly shocked at the amount of our household products that contained palm oil from non-responsible sources and have made drastic changes to our shopping each week in light of this. My daughter has spoken to her school, friends and family encouraging them to #checkyourcupboards but she wants to do more!

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Add sustainability to the National Curriculum
attributes.background: I would like the government to add a sustainability to the national curriculum and start teaching how our actions and decisions impact the world.
attributes.additional_details:
We are at a critical point in the world with CO2 levels at a record high, over fishing killing our seas, deforestation occurring at an alarming rate, global warming causing terrifying conditions globally.

Education is vital to ensure people support the positive actions towards a better future within the near future. Without education the nation will not actively support the changes required!

attributes.action: Require warning labels on palm oil products that are not produced sustainably
attributes.background: The Government should require products containing palm oil, where it has not been certified that this has been produced sustainably, to include labels showing the harm palm oil production causes, so consumers are made aware of this.
attributes.additional_details:
Palm oil is a huge contributor to deforestation in tropical climates, areas booming with wildlife, areas which many animals have called home for thousands of years. The deforestation caused by palm oil plantations have had a substantial negative impact on these areas, causing mass death and extinction of the animals living there. in Borneo, dozens orangutans are killed every week due to the production of palm oil.
This needs to end, and this is a start.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Take action to tackle global deforestation
attributes.background: The Government should implement policies to seek to tackle global deforestation including carbon trading schemes, diplomatic measures to pressure foreign governments to tackle deforestation, and use of sanctions against governments involved in deforestation.
attributes.additional_details: Global deforestation is a major contributing factor to both global warming and climate change. Both of these are existential threats to our planet so we must take all possible steps to counter them.

attributes.action: Ban the importation of wood pellets used for the generation of electricity.
attributes.background: Importation of wood pellets should be banned and the use in power stations should be urgently reviewed. Burning of wood pellets must not be considered sustainable or a means of meeting net zero targets. Billions of UK green subsidies into this technology must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Using wood pellets releases more CO2 than burning coal. Because the government considers wood pellets as a renewable resource, by re-planting trees, the emissions are classed as carbon neutral and “helps” to get closer to the neutral target in 2030. This is not the case. Deforestation is happening around the world to supply the UK with wood pellets for burning, which generates around 11% of our energy needs. British taxpayers are funding this destruction of forests.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Pressure the Indonesian government to put a stop to deforestation
attributes.background: The British Government needs to pressure the Indonesian government to put a stop to deforestation by palm oil companies. The tribes who live in the rainforest in Papau New Guinea deserve justice. An area the size of Chicago has been destroyed.
attributes.additional_details:
Nearly 60,000 hectares of forests have been cleared - an area the size of Chicago.
 
A 2018 report by the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) said there was no evidence that illegal fires had been set by palm oil companies. However the BBC obtained a copy which found “evidence beyond reasonable doubt” that 30,000 hectares of forest had been destroyed in breach of FSC regulations.

attributes.action: Ban the import of goods that have not been certified as sustainably sourced
attributes.background: The Government should ban the import of goods that are not sustainably sourced, such as those that contribute to deforestation and habitat destruction. This would pressure companies to become more sustainable. Products should need to be certified as sustainably sourced to be imported.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 150 acres of rainforest are lost every minute. We contribute when we buy from a company whose products result in forests being cleared to produce things like palm oil. Often, we do not have control or we don’t know.
 
If the government puts pressure on companies, they will change their practices. We know this because, after the ban of ozone-destroying CFCs, companies found alternatives quickly. We urge the government to take action before damage done to the biodiversity of our planet becomes irreversible.

attributes.action: Require use of Sustainable Aviation Fuels (SAFs) and increase taxes on non-SAFs
attributes.background: The UK should pass a law requiring all aircraft operating in the UK use Sustainable Aviation Fuels (SAFs). The share of SAFs required should rise annually, reaching the maximum allowed by 2030. Simultaneously, non-SAF fuel should be taxed at a growing rate to ensure it is costlier than SAFs by 2030.
attributes.additional_details:
SAFs are made from sustainable sources. A variety of SAFs are licensed for use in current planes. They can reduce the net CO2 impact of flying, but they cost more than fossil jet fuel, so demand & production are still low. That is why Government intervention is needed to accelerate progress by assuring growing demand.
 
For sustainability and ethical reasons, only SAFs which don't compete with food production or cause deforestation, and which are not sourced from animals, should be promoted.

attributes.action: Create financial sanctions for companies involved in deforestation of the Amazon
attributes.background: The Government should establish financial sanctions that ban the transfer of funds via UK registered banks for all companies involved directly or indirectly in cutting down the Amazon Rain Forest.
attributes.additional_details: The Amazon plays in important part in the global ecosystem. The only way to effectively put an end to the deforestation is to create disincentives for this activity. One way the UK Government can do this is to prevent the transfer of funds by the companies involved in facilitating this deforestation.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: End all imports of Brazilian soy in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Deforestation in the Amazon rain forest is at a 12 year high. Much of this deforestation is because of clearance for soy farming. It is therefore vital to send a message out that we do not tolerate the destruction of one of the most precious wildlife sanctuaries on Earth.
attributes.additional_details: The Amazon rain forest is home to an incredible array of flora and fauna and also to many indigenous tribes of South America. It is also a vital carbon sink for the planet. Life on Earth cannot afford to lose the protection from global heating that this rain forest gives us. Follow the example of France and end the import of Brazilian soy to make the Brazilian government protect this vital part of our biosphere, for the sake of all life on Earth.

attributes.action: Lead the world in massively reducing our meat consumption accross the UK
attributes.background: The Government needs to recognise the environmental impact of animal agriculture (especially beef production) and make steps to reduce it. More sustainable backyard farming should be encouraged and farms should have a cap on beef production encouraging smaller back yard farming for self sustaining.
attributes.additional_details: Animal agriculture also has a huge impact to human life. The crisis in Yemen is a preventable tragedy considering we have enough land to feed the planet if we reduce our meat consumption. Millions of Yemen's population are at risk of dying from malnutrition including children and pregnant or lactating women. On top of this, deforestation in the Amazon and other rainforest effect humans and wildlife habitats alike. To not address this issue is to persue financial gain over human beings lives.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Take action to end factory farming and reduce meat and dairy consumption: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330298

Ban the Advertising of Meat Products: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321868

attributes.action: Intercept Bolsonaro’s plans to dismantle environmental protection
attributes.background: To mitigate President Bolsonaro and Minister Salles’ exploitation of the COVID-19 circumstances to deregulate legal protection of the Brazilian environment.
attributes.additional_details: Minister Salles’ has called for development of the Amazon, saying it is “necessary to lift people out of poverty” and that there is a “need to make an effort while we are in this calm moment in terms of press coverage, because they are only talking about COVID”. In lieu of the 55% increase in Amazon deforestation since 2020, the prospective plans from the Brazilian government could be devastating; for the Amazon rainforest and environments. Sign this petition to prevent further deregulation.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

The protection and development of the Amazon is a matter for the governments of jurisdictions which cover the Amazon, and not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: License grouse moors and repurpose some for rewilding to aid biodiversity
attributes.background:
Implement limited grouse moor licenses, with a zero tolerance license loss for heather burning and predator persecution. 

In areas with many grouse moors or where nature needs more aid, do not issue licenses and repurpose the land for rewilding through the RSPB, Wildlife Trusts, and other parties
attributes.additional_details:
Grouse moors cover over 6 million acres of land in the UK. Intensive management has a massive negative effect on the natural world, disrupting peat bogs which lock up carbon (or emit carbon when drained), deforestation, and killing raptors through cruel methods. They have failed in self regulation.

Introducing a license for England and Wales would force good standards. If these standards not met, the vast amounts of land can be repurposed for rewilding, to meet the 2050 Net Zero target.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about activities relating to grouse moors, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

It's not sure exactly what you want to be licensed, or how proposals for rewilding would work where a moor is privately owned.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Palm oil in products on sale in the UK.
attributes.background: I want the Government to ban or significantly reduce the use of products containg Palm oil imported and sold in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The effects of deforestation are well documented. 

As consumers we are providing a demand for products containing Palm oil which will and is currently destroying the homes and natural habitats of wildlife. 

The Government can help slow down and possibly prevent the extinction of exotic species by seizing our contribution to the demand of Palm oil which is responsible for killing our wildlife and damaging our planet.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308368

attributes.action: Ban unsustainable palm oil products being sold in the UK.
attributes.background: If a product contains unsustainable palm oil it shouldn’t be allowed to be imported into the UK and would be prevented from being sold in  supermarkets. We should start educating people on the harm of palm oil and the damage it is reeking across the planet.
attributes.additional_details: Palm oil had been a continual driver of deforestation, killing and heavily damaging some of the worlds most biodiverse forests. Along with this the industry is damaging the habitat of animals like the Sumatran rhino, pygmy elephant, and orangutan, all of whom are already endangered species. Climate change is being exacerbated by carbon-rich peat soils and the loss of forests, which releases millions of tonnes of greenhouse gases into the atmosphere.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Make sustainability a core subject in School syllabus and adult education
attributes.background:
Make sustainability a core or mandatory subject in School syllabus, College and University courses, post graduate courses, driving, health and safety courses, site inductions etc.

Making this vital subject mandatory will educate the nation to focus on a sustainable future for our world.
attributes.additional_details:
We are at a critical point in the world with CO2 levels at a record high, over fishing killing our seas, deforestation occurring at an alarming rate, global warming causing terrifying conditions globally.

Education is vital to ensure people support the positive actions toward a better future within the near future. Without education the nation will not actively support the changes required! This not only needs to target children but also adults, as adults are the primary problem.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The UK Government aren't responsible for the content of college and university courses, postgraduate courses, driving, health and safety courses, site inductions etc.

You could start a petition calling for sustainability to be added to the National Curriculum, if that's something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: The UK should be doing more to combat global deforestation.
attributes.background: Plant more trees and protect forests around the world and pressure foreign governments to follow suit.

rejection.details:
The Government isn't responsible for tree planting and forest protection overseas. 

You could start a petition calling for the Government to work with other Governments to combat global deforestation, or calling for me tree planting in England, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Palm Oil in UK manufactured chocolate.
attributes.background: I would like the Government to speak to UK chocolate manufacturers to eventually stop the use of Palm Oil in chocolate. Using Palm Oil threatens species like orangutans, as their habitats and food sources are getting lost due to deforestation. They will soon go extinct.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the Government to do this as it is not right to kill endangered animal’s habitats. It is possible to manufacture chocolate without Palm Oil as some less popular brands do it. If we loose these animals due to our diets, then we will never get them back. This is our one chance to save endangered animals, and we need to act now. Palm Oil is a product used in food items for taste, and is usually unhealthy food. This is our chance to turn the environment around, and show that we care.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308368

attributes.action: Make flying more sustainable - right now
attributes.background: Please accelerate the journey towards sustainable aviation by rapidly and immediately increasing the amount of sustainable aviation fuels (SAFs) used in the aviation sector. Specifically, SAFs which don't compete with food production or cause deforestation, and which are not sourced from animals.
attributes.additional_details:
SAFs are made from CO2 & water. They cost more than fossil fuels, so demand & production are low. To make flying less harmful, we must start replacing fossil fuel:

The public sector should pay for SAFs when booking flights, e.g. using Compensaid

Aircraft operators should have to buy growing percentages of SAFs, at first covering the 1st class’ share of fuel, then business, eventually applying to all fares (and cargo / charters). 

Fossil fuel should be taxed until it becomes the pricier option

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the sustainability of flying, and want the use of sustainable aviation fuels to increase, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase Air Passenger Duty and introduce taxes for aviation fuel: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574630

Impose legal limits on non-essential flying for everyone: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584120

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we could accept a petition calling for taxes on non-sustainable aviation fuel, or reduced Air Passenger Duty for flights where sustainable aviation fuel is used.

attributes.action: Save and Protect Our Oceans From Commercial Overfishing
attributes.background: We need the government to take action when it comes to commercial fishing and the destruction of planets oceans and seas. 90% of the world's largest fish have now been wiped out and 3.9 billion acres of the seafloor is deforested every year by trawling. It is killing our home, earth.
attributes.additional_details:
The government needs to act fast, we must:

Set up no-catch marine reserves immediately - a short term goal of protecting 30% of our ocean by 2030.

End all UK fishing subsidies, saving hundreds of millions in taxpayers funding, which props up this most destructive industry.

Our oceans are dying, we cannot survive without our oceans, we must act before it is too late. 300,000 dolphins, whales and porpoises are killed in fishing nets every year along with 30,000 sharks a day. We have to act now.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions which call for the same actions:

'Ban fishing on a third of UK coastal for fish repopulation':
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553334

'End UK subsidies to the fishing industry': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581530

attributes.action: Address global crises of overfishing which could empty the seas by 2048.
attributes.background: 90% of the world’s large fish have been wiped out by commercial fishing. Ban UK battery fish farms, and reassess the £23million funding scheme to support UK fishing exports to the EU which contributes to overfishing and battery fish farms. UK to work with Global organisations to tackle this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
Fishing vessels use thirty-mile fishing lines with baited hooks, 300,000 dolphins, whales and porpoises are killed yearly. 3.9 billion acres of seafloor is deforested yearly by trawling.46% of the pacific garbage patch is comprised of fishing nets. Fish farming is associated with infectious diseases and welfare abuses. Sustainable fishing is corrupt. 

The seas are most powerful carbon sinks in the world and most important support system for life on earth and preventing climate change.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you're concerned about fishing, but we're not sure what you'd like the Government to work to change. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make deforestation illegal.
attributes.background: Deforestation is becoming more devastating. We are losing the rainforests rapidly, and simultaneously medicine for life threatening diseases. The Amazon alone absorbs 2 billion tons of carbon dioxide a year, and we just can't afford to lose that.
attributes.additional_details: Making deforestation illegal would save more than just the animals and plants that live there, it would save our planet. Rainforests are decreasing rapidly; once covering 14% of the worlds land surface- now only 6%. Experts estimate that rainforest deforestation is causing 137 plant, animal and insect species to die each day. Right now, 121 prescription drugs are coming from plant derived sources. The rainforests are home home to over half of the worlds animals.

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament can't make laws for other countries. Making deforestation of the Amazon illegal would be the responsibility of the Governments of the countries where the Amazon is located. 

You may wish to sign one of these petitions which call for actions that are within the UK Government or Parliament's responsibility:

Call for global crisis talks for a solution to end the destruction of the Amazon: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551632

Create financial sanctions for companies involved in deforestation of the Amazon: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551860

Ban import of products from Amazon rainforest if not Deforestation Free: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327422

Require clear labelling on all products linked to deforestation: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560732

Ban the import of soy and beef products not certified as free from deforestation: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331919

You may be interested to know that the UK Government has recently announced some plans to help prevent deforestation: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-sets-out-world-leading-new-measures-to-protect-rainforests

attributes.action: Help stop the destruction of the Amazon Forest!
attributes.background:
Thousands of animals get killed each day by the destruction of the Amazon Forest. People burn it down to make way for cattle and land.
The new president, Jair Bolsonaro, isn’t helping matters. With the support of the Brazilian government, the fires have been growing. This needs to end.
attributes.additional_details: Deforestation is one of the biggest sources of carbon dioxide. Without the Amazon, defeating climate change will be impossible. We have already cut down 17% of the forest, scientists have predicted that by 2030 it will be 27%. Some of the indigenous people have been killed trying to stop the burning of their home. I demand England help stop this devastating destruction.

attributes.action: Ban all products or services arising from deforestation
attributes.background: Deforestation is causing direct harm to the natural habitat of thousands of indigenous species of animals.  Deforestation is also cutting off the oxygen supply to the world and adding huge volume of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere.
attributes.additional_details: The UK should no longer play any part in the intentional or unintentional destruction of ancient forests around the world, whether directly or indirectly, in the pursuit of economic or private business interests.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure what you'd like to be covered by "products or services arising from deforestation"

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Stop trade with Brazil until they end deforestation of the Amazon Rainforest
attributes.background: Put sanctions on the Brazilian government until they get deforestation under control.
attributes.additional_details: The amazon produces 20% of all oxygen and it needs protection to help with battling climate change

attributes.action: Make formal examinations computer based to reduce deforestation
attributes.background: Make it so students have to do their formal tests on computers instead of on paper
attributes.additional_details: Because of the current state of affairs with climate change I think examinations cause a huge waste of paper which is reducing our planet of a lot of trees this would be a way to help this

rejection.details: Decisions about the conduct of exams are a matter for exam boards and individual educational institutions, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Put a climate damage score on all foods so consumers can make informed decisions
attributes.background: A third of all climate damage is caused by what we eat whether through deforestation, air miles, or methane emissions. By putting scores on food (like nutritional information) consumers can make a big difference to their carbon footprint by choosing lower scored foods
attributes.additional_details: This is something that individuals can’t do on their own as there is so much we don’t know about our food. For example, one avocado may come from a well established tree, whereas another may come from a source that has had to cut down trees to plant a new avocado tree and so would be a worse choice for the environment. Even if all fossil fuels were stopped tomorrow, the planet will still heat up by 2 degrees by the end of the century if we don’t change how we eat.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see new labelling requirements for food, but it's not clear how you want "climate damage scores" to be calculated.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Transition from animal to arable agriculture to protect against climate change.
attributes.background: Encourage farmers in the UK to switch to arable agriculture to facilitate further growth in plant-based lifestyles which will in turn, reduce our carbon emissions in these desperate times.
attributes.additional_details:
Animal agriculture is the second largest contributor to human-made greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions after fossil fuels and is a leading cause of deforestation, water and air pollution and biodiversity loss.

It is vital that we all take a stand and effect change as a matter of urgency, in order to protect our Earth and to ensure a habitable world exists for future generations.

This is supported by Sir David Attenborough.

I was alarmed to see the lack of consideration for this topic at COP26.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you would like to see more farmers moving away from animal farming but it is unclear which policies or areas of the law you would like changed, or what should be introduced to make this happen. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what specific action you would like the Government or Parliament to take.

attributes.action: Ban disposable barbecues
attributes.background: To pass legislation banning the sale and use of disposable barbecues
attributes.additional_details:
The use of a non-renewable source of energy i.e. charcoal. Obtaining it generates emissions and can lead to deforestation. 
They can not be re-cycled, and the waste goes to land fill sites.  
Used irresponsibly, fires can be started.  Some people leave the behind as litter for other people to pick up.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban The Sale Of Disposable Barbecues: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581929

Ban the production, sale and use of disposal BBQs: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584153

attributes.action: Hold an urgent meeting on climate change. Ban meat that isn’t reliably sourced.
attributes.background: We’re requesting an emergency meeting on climate change and a massive reduction in meat consumption, and to only stock meat which is reliably sourced and has no carbon footprint. We are in the midst of a climate emergency and drastic action needs to be taken right now.
attributes.additional_details: We have just 7 years until there is no turning back from this. Droughts, fires, starvation will be coming to us if we do not turn this around right now. There is a climate emergency and no one is addressing this in parliament. Young people do not stand a chance unless you start to do something drastic to address this immediately. We need to ban plastic, half consumption of meat and only buy from small reliable farms and start doing some work to rectify deforestation.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Take action to end factory farming and reduce meat and dairy consumption: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330298

Reform food, energy, environmental and fishing policy to save the planet: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554376

Hold a referendum to decide if the UK should commit to Carbon Neutrality by 2030: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549900
